Current Adoption.description: Greenroofs.com is noted as voluntary submission and non-comprehensive.

CONVENTIONAL First Cost per Implementati.description: Costs are adjusted for inflation and converted to a per m2 value.

SOLUTION First Cost per Implementation U.description:
Data is converted from sq. ft to sq. meters and inflation factors are applied as needed.

Costs typical of "extensive" green roof".  Intensive roofs cost $200-$400+/m2

SOLUTION Lifetime Capacity.description: Very few data points exist in the literature describing the effective lifetime of green roofs.

CONVENTIONAL Average Annual Use.description: The implementation unit is the same as the functional unit -  a square meter of roof provides 1 square meter of roof each year.

SOLUTION Average Annual Use.description: The implementation unit is the same as the functional unit -  a square meter of roof provides 1 square meter of roof each year.

CONVENTIONAL Variable Operating Cost (VO.description:
Operating costs include operation and maintenance, storm water discharge penalties and energy  use.
Calculated = VMA #27 + #29

SOLUTION Variable Operating Cost (VOM) p.description:
Operating costs are mostly presented as a savings or reduction of conventional operating costs.  A custom calculation is made on sheet 'Operating Cost Factoring' to account for the various components of operating costs.  
Calculated = VAM #28 + #30 + #31

CONVENTIONAL Total Energy Used per Funct.description:
Cooling Electricity used by all stories of the building for "Conventional " cooling / m2 Roof Area
Values are weighted  by adjusted Cool Roof TAM in each Climate Zone

SOLUTION Total Energy Used per Functiona.description:
Cooling Electricity used by all stories of the building for "Solution" cooling / m2 Roof Area.  
Values are weighted  by adjusted Cool Roof TAM in each Climate Zone

CONVENTIONAL Fuel Consumed per Functiona.description:
VMA #15 is Heating fuel used by  all stories of the building by "Conventional" Technology / m2 Roof Area
Values are weighted  by adjusted Green Roof TAM in each Climate Zone.
VMA #16 below, Heating savings for green roofs (in cold climates), is calculated by taking the heating energy of all stories of the building and converting to TJ/square meter roof area per year

SOLUTION Fuel Efficiency Factor.description:
This positive efficiency of is a benefit of green roofs insulation for reduced heating costs especially common in cool climates.  All original units are converted to TJ.  Values are weighted  by adjusted Green Roof TAM in each Climate Zone.
The heating benefit for green roofs, usually stated as % of top floor heating energy, is calculated here as % of all floor building heating energy in TJ/square meter roof area per year.
